Skip Navigation. Hit enter to return to the slide.

search.slidetext: troubleshooting failure scenarios this module discusses the common failure scenarios related to data availability. then with a network partition simulation, you get to familiar with the troubleshooting process.
failure scenarios network partition storage controller failure drive failure + host failure +
network partition overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors possible causes possible causes possible causes examine examine examine
storage controller failure overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors examine examine examine
host failure without vsphere ha overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors examine examine examine
cache device fails overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors examine examine examine
cache device pulled unexpectedly from esxi host overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors examine examine examine
host failure with vsphere ha overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors examine examine examine
capacity device pulled unexpectedly from esxi host overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors examine examine examine
capacity device fails overview overview overview expected behaviors expected behaviors expected behaviors examine examine examine

check your understanding in a vsan cluster, vms use the storage policy that has ftt set to 1. if the network cables are pulled from an esxi host , on which no vms are running but has some of vm storage objects. which of the following you expect to observe? vm is restarted on another host vm continues to run vm storage objects become inaccessible components residing on the host are marked degraded

check your understanding in a vsan cluster, deduplication and compression are disabled and every disk group has two or more capacity devices. if a disk group is offline, what could be the causes? (choose two) capacity device failure storage controller failure cache device failure network failure

check your understanding a vsan cluster with four hosts is showing four partition groups in the vsphere web client. which of the following could be the cause? vsphere ha is not enabled network failure disk group failure in more than one host witness host failure

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: In this module, you get to learn the common failure scenarios in the framework of what are the expected behaviors, what are the alarms triggered, what/where to examine, and then practice identifying and investigating a problem with the troubleshooting network partition simulation.

This slide lists some common vSAN failure scenarios. Click each to learn the different types of failures in more details, such as the warning you will receive, the expected behaviors you will observe, and places you can examine.

Correct response: Because the storage objects are set to tolerate at least one failure in the cluster, the VM that has storage objects residing on the failed host continues to run because it still has one complete mirror of the data available.

Correct response: In a single controller configuration, only one disk group exists with one cache device in the host. You might not be able to determine whether a cache device failure or a storage controller failure might occur. Both failures affect the whole disk group.
Correct response: None of the hosts in the cluster can communicate with each other across the network.
